text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly states that 'Northern Ireland is effectively in both the UK and EU markets for goods,' which directly addresses the core concept of the criterion: that NI was established as part of the single customs territory with both the UK and the EU, functioning as a customs valve (implied by the free movement to the Republic of Ireland and checks from Great Britain). It correctly identifies the Windsor Framework as the resolution to issues stemming from the Northern Ireland Protocol, which established this dual status.", "criterion_id": "821ddcea-7e1d-45b8-8fba-32e37ae23575"}
